1.rationale:
Looking at our current head at (9,8), we see our legal moves are limited. We can’t go RIGHT (it would leave the board) and going DOWN would take us back into our own body at (9,7). That leaves UP and LEFT.

If we move UP, our head would go to (9,9) – an open cell – but then our only safe follow‐up is to go LEFT (since RIGHT is off the board and DOWN would be back into our body). That extra upward move would take us into the corner, making it a bit more roundabout if our goal is to reach one of the nearby apples.

On the other hand, moving LEFT puts our head at (8,8). This move is safe because (8,8) is unoccupied. Plus, it shifts our snake away from the right edge (where part of our own body is) so that in subsequent moves we can start moving downward along column 8. Notice that one of our apples is at (8,3), which lies directly below if we can clear a vertical path. After moving LEFT, on our next moves we can go DOWN repeatedly – the snake’s tail will be vacated as it moves – and eventually reach the apple at (8,3).

This path toward the apple on column 8 is more direct and minimizes the risk of boxing ourselves in near the top edge.

So I decide my next move is: LEFT.

While RIGHT might get us toward the apple at (9,5) a bit quicker, that route puts us against the right edge and requires an extra turn, which could be riskier given our current configuration and the need to avoid trapping ourselves.

Thus, continuing to head DOWN is the safest, most straightforward route toward a guaranteed apple pickup at (8,3).

My strategy for the upcoming turns is to keep moving down until I reach (8,3) (eating the apple and growing) and then reevaluate to head safely toward the next target.

My decided next move is: DOWN.
